intro: Astragalus cobrensis var. maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and shrublands. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
